data.text: In three things I was beautified,
But three sorts of men  my soul hateth,
In thy  youth thou hast not gathered,
How beautiful a thing is judgement for gray hairs,
How beautiful is the wisdom of old men,
Much experience is the crown of old men;
There be nine things that I have thought of, and in mine heart counted happy;
Happy is he that dwelleth with a wife of understanding;
Happy is he that hath found prudence;
How great is he that hath found wisdom!
The fear of the Lord passeth all things:
Verse 12 is omitted by the best authorities.
Give me  any plague but the plague of the heart;
Any calamity, but a calamity from them that hate me;
There is no head above the head of a serpent;
I will rather dwell with a lion and a dragon,
The wickedness of a woman changeth her look,
Her husband shall sit at meat among his neighbours,
All malice is but little to the malice of a woman:
As  the going up a sandy way is  to the feet of the aged,
Throw not thyself upon the beauty of a woman;
There is anger, and impudence, and great reproach,
A wicked woman is abasement of heart,
From a woman was  the beginning of sin;
Give not water an outlet;
If she go not Gr. according to thy hand.  as thou wouldest have her,
